column4: KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 23 (Bernama) -- Malaysia’s strong digital infrastructure as well as political and policy stability are driving technology and digital investments into the country, Communications Minister Datuk Fahmi Fadzil said.

column3: Chinese Hackers Use Anthropic’s Claude AI to Automate 90% of Cyber Espionage
column4: Chinese hackers used Anthropic's AI model Claude to automate 90% of a cyber espionage campaign targeting Western companies, banks, and governments in 2025. This highlights China's AI-driven attacks exploiting Western open innovation. Experts urge stronger safeguards, regulations, and AI defenses to counter escalating threats.

column3: Italy Fines Apple €98.6M for Anticompetitive App Tracking Practices
column4: Apple's App Tracking Transparency (ATT) feature, designed to enhance user privacy by requiring consent for ad tracking, has faced global backlash. Italy fined Apple €98.6 million for anticompetitive practices favoring its ecosystem. Amid regulatory scrutiny in Europe, India, and the UK, Apple defends ATT as essential protection while appealing the decision.

column3: NIST and MITRE Launch $20 Million AI Cybersecurity Centers
column4: NIST and MITRE launch AI research centers for cybersecurity and manufacturing.The $20 million initiative emphasizes stakeholder involvement and practical solutions.Federal efforts aim to strengthen critical infrastructure against AI-enabled cyber threats.

column3: OpenAI says AI browsers may always be vulnerable to prompt injection attacks
column4: OpenAI says prompt injections will always be a risk for AI browsers with agentic capabilities, like Atlas. But the firm is beefing up its cybersecurity with an 'LLM-based automated attacker.'

column3: Microsoft Launches MahaCrimeOS AI to Fight Cybercrime in Maharashtra
column4: Microsoft has launched MahaCrimeOS AI in partnership with Maharashtra's government, an Azure-based platform to aid police in combating cybercrime and fraud. This initiative, part of broader AI expansions including OpenAI collaborations and security enhancements, positions Microsoft as a leader in AI-driven public safety and cybersecurity.

column4: Ahmed Kamel – Egypt Daily News Egypt has achieved a significant advancement in digital government development, ranking 22nd worldwide in the GovTech Maturity Index, according to a senior government official. column3: Google to Discontinue Dark Web Report Feature in February 2026
column4: Google is discontinuing its Dark Web Report feature in February 2026, which scanned for users' leaked personal data on the dark web, citing redundancy with other tools. Launched in 2023, it joins Google's "graveyard" of axed services amid mixed user reactions and a shift toward AI-driven security alternatives. This highlights evolving privacy priorities in tech.

column3: Tesla Optimus Robot Enters Mass Production, Targeting 2025 Rollout
column4: Tesla's Optimus humanoid robot is advancing from prototype to mass production, targeting thousands of units by 2025 for tasks in factories, logistics, and homes. This could disrupt labor markets, boost efficiency, and spark ethical debates on job displacement and AI integration. Competitors like CATL intensify the race, promising widespread societal changes.

column3: New York will soon require social media platforms to add warning labels for minors — everything you need to know
column4: New York State has enacted a law requiring social media platforms to add warning labels for teen accounts.

column3: NordVPN Releases Open-Source NordLynx Package for OpenWrt Routers
column4: NordVPN has released an open-source, headless Linux package for OpenWrt routers on GitHub, enabling easy network-wide VPN setup via the NordLynx protocol. This promotes transparency, invites community contributions, and enhances trust in cybersecurity. It positions NordVPN as a leader in verifiable, efficient privacy tools.

column3: Activists Scrape Spotify’s 300TB Music Library for Torrent Release
column4: Anti-copyright activists from Anna's Archive scraped Spotify's entire music library, extracting 256 million metadata rows and 86 million audio files totaling 300 terabytes, planning free torrent distribution for preservation. Spotify condemned the act as extremism and is investigating, sparking debates on digital rights and industry impacts.

column3: AI Expert Warns of Talent Shortage in Fighting Prompt Injection Threats
column4: AI security expert Sander Schulhoff warns that companies lack specialized staff and tools to combat unique AI threats like prompt injection, differing from traditional cyber risks. Reports highlight talent shortages, emerging attacks, and the need for red teaming and education. Urgent investment in AI-specific defenses is essential to prevent catastrophic breaches.
